result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Child Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Keith A. Nelson
parties.address: 517 Court St, Clark County Jail, Neillsville, WI 54456

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim's mother due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The unpaid costs are reduced to a civil judgment.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning May 1, 2018.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Chippewa County Case 17CF397 and any other case

Defendant Keith A. Nelson in court with attorney Hannah E Huettl.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Revocation packet was filed.  No objection to the revocation packet per Attorney Huettl.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty. Statement by Attorney Huettl.  Court orders 1 year county jail with huber and good time concurrent to Chippewa County Case - 17CF397; unpaid court costs are reduced to a civil judgment.  Sentence credit of 233 days.  Unpaid costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning May 1, 2018. Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt

records.addlTxt: Defendant Keith A. Nelson in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Keith A. Nelson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed.   Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim rights complied.  Plea of no contest.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence probation 3 years with conditions of court costs; DNA surcharge and sample; service of process fee of $75.00; letter of apology to victim's mother due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Sentence Credit of 70 days.  - rt
